Posts.Content: bowoky wrote: I posted a few days ago about not having insurance and having a lump. I had a mammogram and ultrasound that came up negative, but now I still have symptoms of pain and lumpiness. Someone recommended I get insurance before I have been diagnosed, so I signed up for an expensive private plan today but aren't they going to deny me after I go to the doctor because I had the lump two months ago? Isn't that still pre existing? I am really scared now. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pre existing and insurance bowoky vlnrph

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2017 03:39PM bowoky wrote: I am so sorry you are going through this stress. I know exactly how you feel. My mom was diagnosed with stage 4 ILC last summer and it was a whirlwind of doctors appointments, waiting, and stress. At first they thought it was bone cancer because my mom's type didn't show up in any other tests except an MRI. I know it's hard, but keep in mind that you just don't know yet. I am happy to report that my mom's body shows no signs of cancer today after taking a drug called Ibrance, which she will have to continue to take. There is so much out there for breast cancer now, so it is NOT a death sentence. Hang in there
Posts.Title: Mom has spiculated mass, needs biopsy jillybeantabby EpicSquirrel

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2017 04:37AM bowoky wrote: I think that sounds like a good decision. Keep us posted
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: May 10, 2017 11:26AM bowoky wrote: I just had a male friend who had Costco. I thought about that for my own breast pain, but I don't fit all the symptoms. Glad your doctor is sure and you can relax now. :)..
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2017 01:06PM bowoky wrote: Sem83, My pain is manageable without meds, but right now it's the worst because of PMS. It's more irritating and gnawing than debilitating. I have a very physical job and I notice after I work a long day it gets worse. I would say my best advice is take itone day at a time. We can only realistically take care of today. Also, do something you love. I am taking an online writing class and that's helping to occupy my mind. Let's also hope you get good news on your son's birthday. I'll say a prayer for you that day. :) Artista928, you are right, cancer is jaw droppingly expensive. My mom pays $1200 per month for her pills and I've seen her medical bills. My brother in law also has stage iv rhabdomyosarcoma and even with great insurance, he and my sister are struggling. My family has been through the ringer with this illness. As for not having insurance, I have to take that one day at a time as well. Today I got financial assistance for the MRI from a foundation, I'm very grateful for this. I'm realizing a lot of people seem confused about ACA. I had it last year, they dropped my plan, and I couldn't afford the new plans this year so we opted out, which means we will owe a penalty. This is the current problem with our healthcare system and why I think we need single payer. I make too much for Medicaid, but too little to afford the premiums.
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2017 12:45AM bowoky wrote: I guess I really shouldn't be googling the dyes because there's some scary information out there. I'm an extremely healthy person and the idea of putting a heavy metal in my blood stream scares me.
Posts.Title: MRI Questions bowoky gb2115

Posts.Content: bowoky wrote: I'm getting an MRI on Friday after Mammo and US came up normal. I have skin tethering, pain, and a lump that fluctuates with my cycle. I'm concerned about the contrast dye for the MRI, Is that something that could be poisonous for my body? Also, what are the chances I could have a false positive? I'm also having to wait two weeks for my follow up appointment and that makes me nervous. I posted on the not diagnosed, but worried section and moved here since I'm now in the testing faze. Hope all my questions aren't annoying. Just finding it hard to function like a normal human being with all this lingering. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI Questions bowoky gb2115

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2017 04:17AM - edited Apr 21, 2017 04:19AM by bowoky sem83, your story sounds so much like mine! Except I don't have a cyst. I had a very similar experience at the radiology office. They told me the pain was probably my dense tissue and hormones, but the breast surgeon said nothing about that. I forget, can you feel a lump? It might be musculoskeletal, I thought that the way you describe it, I'm a massage therapist, but not a doctor. I would either get a second opinion from a breast surgeon or wait and see if the pain goes away. I'm not sure what tests besides an MRI they would do for musculoskeletal. I lean more towards a second opinion.
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2017 11:37AM bowoky wrote: Artista928, I have a different situation. I don't have insurance so we have to find the quickest, most cost effective route to an answer. Plus, they can't find anything to biopsy so I have to have an MRI. The MRI is most accurate if your breast tissue isn't dense from having your period and mine gets extremely dense during that time, which is coming up,Also, my doctor was by no means saying that breast cancer doesn't come with pain, she was just saying it's less common, but she definitely said she would never overlook someone who came in with pain. I think she was just trying to be reassuring as I was pretty emotional.
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2017 11:18AM bowoky wrote: Sem83, I have persistent pain also with negative findings in Mammo and us. My doctor has suggested I see a breast specialist to go over all the possibilities. I have my appointment this Monday and will let you know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2017 10:59AM bowoky wrote: Sem83, The specialist did another Ultrasound and a physical exam. She also rechecked my Mammo. She didn't find anything in the tests that were concerning, but since she could feel the lump and see my indentation she wants me to get an MRI. I have to wait until the right time in my cycle, so that won't be until two weeks from now. I still have pain. She did say that it's not 'common' to have pain with malignancy, but she would never rule it out. I'm giving in more to all of these tests as time goes on. I need the peace of mind. I'm glad I saw a specialist, she definitely knows her stuff. I would highly recommend seeing a breast expert if you are in a situation like ours. I read so many on this forum whose doctors hesitate on MRIs or dismiss symptoms
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2017 10:58AM bowoky wrote: sem83, Thinking of you and your appointment tomorrow! Hope you've been able to take good care of yourself. Let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2017 04:40AM bowoky wrote: sem83, A couple of thoughts: None of us are doctors and we all come from our own experiences, so ultimately it's all up to you, but if you're like me you want to figure this out. I actually asked the breast specialist if my pain could be musculoskeletal and she said its a possibility. I perform deep tissue massage regularly and that can be hard on my pec muscles. BUT she thinks anything presenting as a breast cancer symptom should rule out bc first. This is coming from a doctor who specializes in hard to dx malignant and benign breast issues. Another thing is that 80% of all biopsies are benign, so there's some hope in that :) .. Artista, what were your original symptoms? Breast lump and pain? But nothing at all showed in a Mammo or us? I know this happens. How are you doing today
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2017 07:35AM - edited Apr 21, 2017 07:37AM by bowoky sem83, Sounds like you have a plan. I hope the pain goes away and everything turns out ok! Artista, Thank you for sharing your story, that's quite a lot to go through. I hope that pain in your pelvis is nothing too severe and Ihope you continue to get good results from your treatment. My mom is currently taking Ibrance and Letrizole and doing really well. She was diagnosed with stage iv ILC metastasis to bones last summer. She literally had no symptoms and then out of nowhere her bones hurt so bad she went to the ER. No breast cancer in our family either. She's 67. Its so scary that it can come on with so little warning. I had no idea until this happened to her.
